Michael Stack wrote:
> Adam Brokeï¿½ wrote:
>> Hi,
>> I have question about QuotaEnforcer.
>> Is there any possibility to log sites that have more pages then limit 
>> set in host-max-fetch-successes? (when the site reach limit, write it to 
>> logs)
>>   
> 
> You'd have to add it.  Would be easy enough to do though.  See 
> http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/prefetch/QuotaEnforcer.html#237.  
> Add in a logger at around line #222.  Have it write out the curi (CrawlURI).

Any URIs blocked by quota will appear in the crawl.log with the -5003 
(S_BLOCKED_BY_QUOTA) code, so that might be enough.

The ultimate vision for this feature will be to hold those over-quota 
URIs in a side queue somewhere, so that the operator could examine them, 
perhaps raise the quota settings allowing crawling to continue from 
where it stopped, or dump them for reporting. There is not yet a 
schedule for implementing this, though.

- Gordon @ IA
